text: The 1995 LPGA Championship was the 41st LPGA Championship, played May 11–14 at DuPont Country Club in Wilmington, Delaware. Kelly Robbins won her only major title, one stroke ahead of defending champion Laurie Davies. Robbins had led after each of the first two rounds, but fell a stroke behind leader Davies after 54 holes. In a cool rain on Sunday, Robbins birdied three of the final seven holes to pass Davies for the win. This was the second of eleven consecutive LPGA Championships at DuPont Country Club. It was the richest major on tour from 1990 through this year, passed by the U.S. Women's Open in 1996. ==Past champions in the field== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- | align=left|Laura Davies || align=left| || 1994 || 68 || 68 || 69 || 70 || 275 || −9 || 2 |- | align=left|Patty Sheehan || align=left| || 1983, 1984, 1993 || 67 || 68 || 72 || 73 || 280 || −4 || T3 |- | align=left|Pat Bradley || align=left| || 1986 || 71 || 70 || 70 || 71 || 282 || −2 || T8 |- | align=left|Betsy King || align=left| || 1992 || 69 || 71 || 72 || 72 || 284 || E || T11 |- | align=left|Meg Mallon || align=left| || 1991 || 70 || 72 || 71 || 72 || 285 || +1 || T15 |- | align=left|Beth Daniel || align=left| || 1990 || 71 || 73 || 72 || 70 || 286 || +2 || T18 |- | align=left|Nancy Lopez || align=left| || 1978, 1985, 1989 || 73 || 71 || 68 || 74 || 286 || +2 || T18 |- | align=left|Sherri Turner || align=left| || 1988 || 73 || 74 || 70 || 70 || 287 || +3 || T26 |- | align=left|Jane Geddes || align=left| || 1987 || 71 || 71 || 71 || 75 || 288 || +4 || T29 |- | align=left|Sally Little || align=left| || 1980 || 73 || 73 || 71 || 73 || 290 || +6 || T38 |- | align=left|Jan Stephenson || align=left| || 1982 || 74 || 72 || 76 ||align=left colspan=4|WD |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, May 14, 1995 {|class="wikitable" !
